questions.text: The McMurray's test is used in the evaluation of which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Meniscal injuries Used for evaluation of Meniscal injuries Tests for meniscal injury McMurray's test Apley's grinding test Patient is in a prone position Knee flexed to 90 degrees The leg is rotated force applied A painful response signifies a torn or degenerated meniscus.

Highyeild:

Medial and Lateral meniscus McMurray's test: With the patient in supine position the knee is acutely and forcibly flexed. The foot is rotated externally. Now the examiner palpates the posteromedial margin of the joint with one hand and by other the foot if firmly grasped. Now the knee is slowly extended. As the femur passes over the torn part of the meniscus a click may be heard. The angle of flexion at which the symptoms occurs indicates the position of the tear. The more posterior is the tear, the more flexed position of the knee is when the sign becomes positive. For lateral meniscus similar test with the foot internally rotated and examiner's hand palpating the posterolateral aspect of knee is carried out.

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. Not used in Fracture of hip Option: C. Not used in the joint following replacement arthroplasty Option: D. - Not used in an orthopedic implant

questions.text: A patient presented with a clinical condition called patella alta. It is defined as which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Drawn through the superior pole of patella

options.label: B
options.text: The line joining the ASIS with the center of patella

options.label: C
options.text: Drawn through the roof of the intercondylar notch of femur

options.label: D
options.text: The line joining the greater trochanter and the center of the patella

questions.correct_answer: C. Drawn through the roof of the intercondylar notch of femur
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Drawn through the roof of the intercondylar notch of femur Increased Q angle is seen in a high-riding patella (patella alta) ; Compressive force on the patellar articular surface during flexion and extension is likely to be greater than normal. Patella alta is best measured on the lateral X-ray. Blumensaat line , also known as the intercondylar line, is the line drawn along the roof of the intercondylar notch of the femur on the sagittal view of the knee.

Highyeild:

Patella Alta (High riding patella The position of patella is considered high. Can be idiopathic or secondary to a patellar tendon rupture. It is associations with idiopathic retro-patellar pain, recurrent dislocation of the patella, chondromalacia patellae, knee joint effusion Blumensaat line is a line drawn through the roof of the intercondylar notch, the lower pole of the patella is supposed to touch this line if it is above this line then it is termed as patella alta and thus predisposed to lateral dislocation

questions.text: A 20-year-old female came with a twisting injury to her right ankle. Name This X-ray view of the ankle.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mortise view Option: B. 3 most common views taken for the ankle are – Anterior-posterior, lateral, and mortise views.

Highyeild:

Mortise view - the leg is rotated internally 15° to 20°, thus aligning the intermalleolar line parallel to the detector. This usually results in the 5th being directly in line with the center of the calcaneum. This projection is for assessing the articulation of the tibial plafond and two malleoli with the talar dome.

questions.text: The structure that primarily supports the medial arch of the foot is which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Spring ligament Option B. Spring ligament (Plantar calcaneo-navicular ligament) best supports the medial arch of the foot. It is a complex of three ligaments on the underside of the foot that connect the calcaneus with the navicular bone. A sprain to the plantar calcaneonavicular ligament can result in flatfoot deformity and impair mobility.
